001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.test;
002
003import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
004import org.slf4j.Logger;
005import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
006
007import java.io.IOException;
008
009/**
010 * Wait for synchronization with a reference source of block height.
011 *
012 * Since synchronization may take time, we check the block height again
013 * after waitForBlock returns.
014 */
015public interface BlockchainSyncing {
016    Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BlockchainSyncing.class);
017
018    /**
019     * Wait until a {@link BitcoinClient} is synced to a reference blockheight
020     * @param client The client we want to synchronize
021     * @return the blockheight upon synchronization
022     */
023    default int waitForSync(BitcoinClient client) throws IOException {
024        //
025        // Get in sync with the block chain
026        //
027        int curHeight = 0;
028        int newHeight = getReferenceBlockHeight();
029        log.info("Reference current height: {}", newHeight);
030        while ( newHeight > curHeight ) {
031            curHeight = newHeight;
032            Boolean upToDate = client.waitForBlock(curHeight, 60*60);
033            newHeight = getReferenceBlockHeight();
034            log.info("Current reference block height: {}", newHeight);
035        }
036        return curHeight;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Use an external reference to get the current block height
041     * See: BlockchainDotInfoSyncing
042     */
043    int getReferenceBlockHeight();
044}
